TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , PERSON , is an NORP national who was born in DATE and is currently serving a prison sentence in GPE penitentiary institution in GPE . He was represented before ORG by Ms N. PERSON and Mr PERSON , lawyers practising in GPE , and PERSON . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON , Representative of GPE at ORG .
CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicant was born in DATE in GPE , GPE . He is NORP by origin .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant moved with his family to GPE . In DATE he graduated from ORG , with a degree in history and oriental studies . From DATE , the applicant worked in ORG as a historian and oriental specialist . From DATE to DATE he also worked for ORG radio as a presenter and translator into NORP .

CARDINAL . In the same period , from DATE to CARDINAL , the applicant served with the intelligence service of the ORG military circuit under the codename “ LOC ” . He had the rank of chief radio operator and his functions included carrying out appropriate activities on the territory of GPE in times of war .
CARDINAL . DATE the applicant worked as the head of the division for GPE in ORG . In DATE he also worked as the chief expert in ORG of GPE .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant was appointed as a NORP interpreter and chief specialist on GPE at ORG , where he worked until his dismissal in DATE due to a reduction of the staff .

CARDINAL . From DATE the applicant wrote analytical articles for a number of NORP ( PERSON , PERSON and PERSON ) and NORP ( Radical ) newspapers . He also worked on a contractual basis for other NORP media : from DATE for ORG ( PERSON ) , and from DATE for the ORG station and the ORG web - site . The applicant also cooperated with ORG ( ORG ) . Furthermore , he regularly accompanied NORP journalists on their visits to GPE in the capacity of an interpreter .
CARDINAL . The applicant submits that from DATE he became involved in trade , making regular trips to GPE , alone or with his wife , re - selling clothes .

CARDINAL . On DATE criminal proceedings were instituted against the applicant , who was suspected of collecting information concerning events , organisations and people in GPE and PERSON , and communicating it to the NORP intelligence services .

CARDINAL . On DATE at TIME the applicant and his wife , while on their way to GPE , were arrested at the NORP - Georgian border and were placed in different rooms in the customs office . Thereafter , they were searched and placed in a police car , where they stayed until TIME .
CARDINAL . On DATE at TIME the police car headed for GPE . Upon arrival in GPE at TIME the applicant and his wife were placed in different rooms in ORG ( ՀՀ ազգային անվտանգության նախարարություն ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE from TIME to TIME the applicant was questioned as a suspect . According to him , the investigators applied psychological pressure and blackmail , forcing him to confess . In particular , they threatened that , if he refused to confess , his wife and his epileptic son would be detained . The applicant submitted that , for this reason , he had no other choice than to confess . Thus , in order to defuse the situation , to have his wife released and to gain some time by fooling the investigators , he decided to make a false confession by making up a story which included fictitious names , districts and undercover flats which never existed . As a basis for his story he used certain real people and circumstances encountered on his regular trips to GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was formally charged under LAW of the then Criminal Code ( ՀՀ քրեական օրենսգիրք , CARDINAL.CARDINAL.CARDINAL – “ the ORG ” ) with espionage committed to the detriment of GPE ’s sovereignty , territorial integrity , national security and defence . In particular , he was charged with being enrolled in ORG ( PERSON Teskilati – “ the ORG ” ) in DATE and until DATE providing information to them on a paid basis concerning GPE ’s and PERSON military , economic and political spheres , in particular concerning the NORP troops based in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was remanded in custody by a court order . From TIME to TIME the applicant was questioned again in connection with the above charges . He submitted that he did not wish to have a lawyer . He further admitted his guilt and repented of his actions .

CARDINAL . In sum , the applicant ’s confession statements of CARDINAL and CARDINAL DATE contained the following submissions . The applicant had established his first contact with various NORP journalists during his work at ORG , as part of his public relations function . Some of these contacts had later developed into professional cooperation , such as preparation of journalistic materials for the ORG and ORG . In DATE the applicant had started to prepare analytical materials concerning GPE ’s political and economic spheres for the ORG officers whom he had met in DATE during his trip to GPE . Later , the communicated materials had also included information of a military nature . To collect the materials in question the applicant had used the NORP press and his personal knowledge . The information had been communicated in the form of either written reports or the applicant reporting in person and answering questions which interested the ORG officers .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s wife hired a defence counsel who was admitted to the case on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the applicant was questioned again , in the presence of his defence counsel , during which the applicant made further submissions and certain questions relating to his previous statements were clarified .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant dispensed with the services of his defence counsel and hired another one .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant made a written statement , retracting his confession statements made earlier . In his statement he presented the allegedly true version of events , describing how since DATE he had started to prepare analytical articles for the ORG web - site and how little by little he had become involved in trade with GPE , thus making more frequent trips to that country . He indicated the names of various people , their relevance and the discussions he had had with them during his trips . The applicant contended that he had never cooperated with any foreign organisation except for mass media . As to his confession statements made earlier , these were a tactical move aimed at having his wife released from detention , securing the safety of his family and preventing any possible violence against himself .

CARDINAL . On DATE the charges against the applicant were modified and stated in greater detail . It was , inter alia , stated that since DATE he had cooperated with various ORG officers , who mostly operated under the veil of journalistic activities . At the beginning , various means had been used to communicate information , such as letters , faxes and telephone calls , but from DATE the applicant had established direct contact with the officers of the ORG GPE office . The act imputed to the applicant was once again qualified under LAW as espionage committed to the detriment of GPE ’s sovereignty , territorial integrity , national security and defence .

CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE and ORG of GPE ( Երևան քաղաքի Կենտրոն և Նորք-Մարաշ համայնքների առաջին ատյանի դատարան ) found the applicant guilty under LAW ORG and sentenced him to DATE in prison with confiscation of all property , concluding that it was substantiated that the applicant had committed high treason and that the act committed by him had been qualified correctly and had features of an offence prescribed by LAW . ORG found :

“ After the dissolution of the GPE , [ the applicant ] , by occupying various high posts in GPE and by being very fluent in NORP , NORP and NORP , was spotted by [ the ORG ] ... Within this period , [ the applicant ] regularly met and maintained contact with various NORP journalists , including [ ORG , GPE , ORG and ORG ] , providing interpretation services or information . According to information received from ORG [ ( ORG ) ] and ORG [ ( ORG ) ] , these individuals were directly linked with the NORP intelligence services ... ”
CARDINAL . ORG went on to detail the positions held by the above individuals and their alleged involvement with the NORP intelligence services . ORG further found that :

“ Having financial problems and being unable to repay his debts , in DATE [ the applicant ] travelled to GPE in search of a well - paid job . There he stayed with his cousin [ I. ] ... [ O]n DATE [ I. ] introduced [ the applicant ] to CARDINAL ORG officers , [ T. and N. ] . They told [ the applicant ] that they needed information concerning ORG [ ( ORG for ORG ) ] , ORG , ORG [ ( ORG ) ] , GPE ’s internal political situation , foreign policy and economic relations , and the NORP troops based in GPE . [ The applicant ] told them that he wanted MONEY for his services . [ T. and ORG ] promised to discuss the issue of remuneration with their superiors . On DATE [ the applicant ] , having met again with the above - mentioned ORG officers , asked them to help him first to repay his debts , after which he would cooperate . During their third meeting on DATE ... [ the applicant ] received a down payment of ORG CARDINAL from ORG officer [ T. ] and promised to provide the required information in DATE . On DATE , upon his return to GPE , [ the applicant ] started to single out from media publications the information which interested the NORP intelligence officers , with the intention of providing it to them later .

On DATE [ the applicant ] travelled to GPE and on DATE he communicated that information to ... the ORG officers . [ He also ] answered their questions concerning GPE ’s internal political life , the political parties in GPE , the contacts that he had with members of these parties , and the activities and location of ORG , receiving USD CARDINAL,CARDINAL from the ORG officers as remuneration for the completed assignment ...

[ On DATE the applicant ] ... met in an undercover flat with ORG officers [ T. and ORG ] , who were displeased with the fact that he provided only media publications and demanded that he use his contacts and provide unpublished secret information concerning GPE ’s political and economic life . [ The applicant ] explained that , in spite of having many contacts with people who had access to confidential information , they would not allow him – and he was not able – to extort secret information . Thereafter , he told them about recent political events in GPE , newspapers published in GPE and their editors ... DATE [ the applicant ] was presented to another ORG officer who introduced himself as [ PERSON ] ... [ PERSON ] reproached [ the applicant ] for providing information with a delay of DATE and explained that high remuneration was out of the question without him providing secret or military information ... At the meeting of [ DATE T. ] demanded that , from that moment , [ the applicant ] indicate his sources when providing information . On DATE [ the applicant ] ... met with [ T. and N. ] and received USD MONEY from [ T. ] in return for the information provided . [ N. ] advised [ the applicant ] to engage in small - scale trade , thereby justifying his frequent trips to GPE ...

On DATE , in GPE , [ the applicant ] met with [ ORG and another officer replacing T. ] and told them about the NORP communities in GPE and the FAC and PERSON regions of GPE . Thereafter , [ the applicant ] presented his notes containing information of a military nature which included information concerning the guarding of the western and southern borders of GPE by the NORP and NORP border guards , the commander of the NORP border guards , the CARDINAL check points at the NORP - Turkish border , the check point at the NORP - NORP border , the presence of border guards in GPE airport , the length of the NORP - NORP and NORP - NORP borders , high - ranking officials in ORG of GPE , the strength of the NORP army and the conscription quota , the bridges in GPE , the troops based in GPE and other similar information . During a regular meeting held in an undercover flat [ the applicant ] was asked questions about NORP weapons and material in GPE . Most of the military - related questions had narrow specialisation and the names of the material were presented in NORP and numerical notes . [ The applicant ] drew the general layout of GPE , indicating the military objectives and bridges in the city , and provided other information . As remuneration [ the applicant ] received from the ORG officers CARDINAL and he returned to GPE .

Continuing his cooperation with the NORP intelligence service and carrying out their assignments , [ the applicant ] - before DATE - travelled to GPE also in DATE and DATE , on each occasion providing to the ORG officers information concerning GPE which interested them and receiving USD CARDINAL,CARDINAL as remuneration . In DATE [ the applicant ] , having received an assignment , wrote down on a blue lined sheet of paper the questions that interested the ORG , which included the military cooperation with GPE , the new weapons provided to GPE by GPE , their location and quantity , the anti - aircraft defence system , ORG , GPE and other issues .

On his last trip to GPE ... on DATE [ the applicant ] was arrested and various documents and notes prepared by him for the ORG officers were found in his possession , which included the answers to the assignments previously received from the NORP intelligence officers as indicated above . This information was collected by [ the applicant ] from various sources and included data concerning the aid provided to GPE by GPE , the credit extended to the GPE from the NORP budget , the unlawful acts taking place in the NORP army , the location of the NORP border - guarding military units , the ammunition and material provided to GPE by GPE as military aid , the military bases used by GPE , the NORP delegations that visited the Nagorno Karabakh Republic for purposes of elimination of mines and missiles , the aid provided to GPE by GPE , the recruitment to the NORP troops based in GPE , the representatives of ORG based in GPE , as well as other information concerning GPE ’s military , political and economic spheres . The following items were also found in [ the applicant ’s ] possession : a map of GPE and a tape recording of a conversation between [ the applicant ] and the NORP secretly made by him at ORG of the NORP - Kurdish Friendship which [ the applicant ] was intending to transmit to the ORG officers as proof of an actual contact with members of ORG .

In such circumstances , the commission of high treason by [ the applicant ] has been substantiated , [ and ] the act committed by him has been qualified correctly and falls within the scope of LAW of LAW . ”

CARDINAL . ORG , as a basis for its findings , first cited in detail the applicant ’s confession statements made during the investigation . It further cited CARDINAL witness statements : CARDINAL of the witnesses DATE who had worked with the applicant in the intelligence service before DATE – characterised him as a well - trained intelligence officer , and CARDINAL others stated that they had met the applicant at ORG of the NORP - Kurdish Friendship and had known him as a translator . As material evidence , the court cited the above tape recording , the map of GPE printed in DATE , the blue lined sheet of paper , a notebook containing the telephone numbers of the ORG officers , the information note received from the ORG and prepared on the basis of materials provided by the ORG , and other notes found in the applicant ’s possession .

CARDINAL . As regards the above confession statements , it appears that the applicant unsuccessfully attempted to rebut them in court . He submitted that he had deliberately given self - incriminating statements in order to have his wife released from detention , to gain some time so that the NORP and NORP intelligence services could intervene and deny the suspicions , and to prevent any possible violence against himself .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date , the applicant lodged an appeal . In his appeal , he complained , inter alia , that the judgment was mainly based on his self - incriminating statements which the court wrongly considered as “ confession statements ” . In reality , he was an analytical journalist and had never cooperated with the NORP intelligence services . The materials found in his possession were the result of his journalistic activities and were taken from the press . Both the investigating authority and the court had misinterpreted the notion of “ other information ” contained in LAW by applying it to the materials in question . Thus , he argued that any material taken from the press could be considered as “ other information ” posing a threat to GPE ’s sovereignty and territorial integrity .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Criminal and Military Court of Appeal ( ՀՀ քրեական և զինվորական գործերով վերաքննիչ դատարան ) dismissed the appeal . In addition to the findings of ORG , ORG noted that :

“ [ After DATE the applicant ] worked in ORG , ORG and ORG , he also worked as a reporter and was involved in trade , however , in reality he was an agent connected with intelligence services . Having been spotted by the NORP intelligence services , from DATE he cooperated with their agents , the majority of whom operated under the veil of various journalistic agencies and organisations . Upon their instructions , he collected and communicated information concerning GPE ’s and PERSON economic and internal political spheres .

For a certain period of time [ the applicant ] cooperated with the NORP intelligence services through various means of communication , including letters , faxes and telephone calls , but starting from DATE he changed the mode of cooperation and established direct contact with the officers of the ORG intelligence office in GPE , including [ N. , ] ... [ T. and PERSON ] ... [ The applicant ] received instructions from them and collected information concerning the type and structure of troops and types of ammunition in [ Nagorno PERSON ] , the existence and location of troops on the LOC mountain , the defence system at the NORP - Turkish border , the existence of radars and military airports , the types and number of military aircraft .

He was also instructed to find out whether GPE had surface - to - surface missiles and collected information concerning NORP “ NORP ” type missiles , roads , tunnels and water reservoirs being built in GPE , the NORP joint military bases , their structure , location , anti - aircraft defence units and types of ammunition , the details of the military cooperation between GPE and GPE , the existence of electronic military bases , the existence of representatives of ORG in GPE and other instructions ...

[ The applicant ] , an employee of ORG , from DATE established contact with [ O.R.O. ] , who was in GPE at that time , and accompanied him on his trips to various regions in GPE and received instructions to provide him with information . As a paid agent of the NORP intelligence services , he communicated to the ORG various information concerning the economic and military - political situation . [ The applicant ] was also in contact with a number of other ORG officers ... ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal on points of law . In his appeal , he argued , inter alia , that all the information in question had been collected from the mass media and was thus in the public domain . He further complained that his conviction was based on his self - incriminating statements .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( ՀՀ վճռաբեկ դատարան ) dismissed the appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE and ORG of GPE , upon the applicant ’s request and pursuant to the requirements of the new LAW enacted on DATE , modified the applicant ’s sentence by annulling the confiscation of his property .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the LAW read as follows :

“ Everyone has the right to express his opinion . It is prohibited to force anyone to give up or change his opinion . Everyone has the right to freedom of expression , including the freedom to seek , receive and impart information and ideas through any information medium regardless of frontiers . ”

“ No restrictions may be placed on the exercise of the rights and freedoms guaranteed under [ LAW other than such as are prescribed by law and are necessary in the interests of national security or public safety , for the protection of public order , health or morals , or for the protection of the rights , freedoms , honour and reputation of others . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the Code read as follows :

“ High treason , that is , a premeditated act committed by an NORP national to the detriment of GPE ’s sovereignty , territorial integrity or national security and defence , such as joining the enemy , espionage , disclosure of a ORG or military secret to a foreign country , flight abroad or refusal to return from abroad , assistance to a foreign country in carrying out hostile activities against GPE , and conspiracy to usurp power , shall be punishable by DATE imprisonment with confiscation of property and DATE of exile or without exile , or by the death penalty with confiscation of property ... ”

“ Communication of information constituting a ORG or military secret , including theft or collection of such information for communication to a foreign country , a foreign organisation or its branch , or communication and collection of other information upon the instructions of a foreign intelligence service to be used to the detriment of GPE ’s interests , if committed by a foreign national or a stateless person , shall be punishable by DATE imprisonment with confiscation of property and DATE of exile , or by the death penalty with confiscation of property . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the ORG and LAW , as in force at the material time , read as follows :

“ The provisions of this LAW are binding on the territory of GPE and outside its borders for public and local self - governing authorities , agencies , institutions and organisations ( irrespective of the type of ownership ) , public officials and citizens , who by their status are under the obligation or have undertaken the obligation to implement the requirements of the NORP legislation on ORG and official secrets . ”

“ A ORG secret is information related to the spheres of military , foreign relations , economic , scientific / technical , intelligence , counter - intelligence and operational intelligence activities of GPE which is protected by the ORG and the dissemination of which may have grave consequences for the security of GPE .

An official secret is information related to the spheres referred to in the first part of this section which is protected by the ORG and the dissemination of which may cause other damage to the security of GPE . As a rule , such information contains data which constitutes a part of a ORG secret , but in itself does not disclose the ORG secret .
Information classified as a ORG or official secret is considered to be the property of GPE and is kept and protected by the ORG . ”
“ The following terms are used in this LAW :

CARDINAL . NORP The media of information constituting a ORG or official secret ( hereafter , information media ) are the material objects , including physical fields , in which the information constituting a ORG or official secret is expressed through images , conventional signs , signals , engineering solutions and processes .
CARDINAL . Encryption of information is the application of restrictions to the dissemination of information constituting a ORG or official secret and information media . ”
“ The following types of information may be classified :

CARDINAL . NORP In the military sphere : ( a ) the contents of documents concerning strategic and operational plans of the armed forces , preparation and conduct of operations , strategic , operational and mobilisation expansion of troops , their combat capacity and the creation and use of the conscript reserve ; ( b ) the programmes of the military - industrial complex , their contents and implementation results , armament and the course of development of arms technology , their strategic and technical characteristics and combat application capacity ; ( c ) the deployment , significance , level of defence and degree of readiness of units of special importance and regime , their design and construction , and allocation of territory for such units ; ( d ) the deployment , true names , organisational structure , armament capacity and size of the regiments and military units of the armed forces of GPE and those of allied states located on the territory of GPE ; and ( e ) the level of defence and safety of the population in times of martial law ... ”
“ Information shall be classified according to the sphere to which it belongs or the authority under whose competence it falls .

With the purpose of implementing a common encryption mechanism , a list of classified information shall be drawn up in a procedure prescribed by the Government of GPE which shall also indicate the public authorities competent to manage each piece of information ... ”

“ Encryption of information is the process of determining the level of secrecy of each separate piece of information and assigning a secrecy label to the relevant information carrier in accordance with a procedure prescribed by the Government of GPE ... ”

“ Access to a ORG or official secret may be granted to : ( a ) citizens of GPE on a voluntary basis ; and ( b ) foreign nationals or stateless persons in accordance with a procedure prescribed by the Government of GPE .

In order to have access to a ORG or official secret citizens must be authorised to do so , upon their written consent , by the competent authorities through entering into a work agreement with public authorities , agencies , institutions or organisations on the basis of favourable results of the security clearance measures taken in their respect ... ”

CARDINAL . This decree approved the list of classified information which contained a table comprising such information and the relevant public authorities competent to manage each piece of information . The following information related to the military sphere was , inter alia , included in the list :
( CARDINAL ) information on the size changes , combat staff , strength and operational readiness of troops and information on the military / political and operational situation ;

( CARDINAL) information disclosing the deployment , true names , organisational structure , armament capacity and size of troops which is not subject to dissemination in accordance with the international obligations undertaken by GPE ;
( CARDINAL ) information disclosing the nature and the organisation or the results of the main types of activity of the NORP border troops , and the border guard system ... ”
